Nov. 8th 2017 LiGaze won the Best Paper Nominee at Sensys'17 Jul. 17th 2017 LiGaze got accepted by Sensys'17 Jun. 27th 2017 Aili got accepted by Ubicomp'17 Mar. 1st 2016 Our StarLight got accepted by MobiSys'16 Sept. 11st 2015 LiSense won the Best Video Award at MobiCom'15 Jun. 4th 2015 Our LiSense got accepted by MobiCom'15 May 21st 2015 Our HiLight got Best Demo Award by MobiSys'15 May 18th 2015 Our WiScan got accepted by UbiComp'15 Feb. 13th 2015 Our HiLight got accepted by MobiSys'15 Sept. 11th 2014 Our HiLight won Best Paper Award by VLCS'14 Sept. 11th 2014 I won Bronze Medal of Student Research Competition at MobiCom'14 Sept. 9th 2014 Our StudentLife won Best Paper Nominee by UbiComp'14 Mar. 5th 2014 Our StudentLife got accepted by UbiComp'14 I am an Assistant Professor in the Computer Science and Engineering Department at Michigan State University (MSU). Prior to MSU, I was a Post-doc in the Computer Science Department at UMASS Amherst, working with Prof. Deepak Ganesan. I received my Ph.D. in the Computer Science Department at Dartmouth College in 2020. My Ph.D advisor was Prof. Xia Zhou. I earned my M.S. at Dartmouth College in 2014 and double B.E. from Australian National University and Beijing Institute of Technology in 2012. My research interests are in wireless communication, sensing, mobile security, and low-power systems. Specifically, my recent work focuses on designing practical and secure mobile systems. My work won the Best Paper Award at PerCom 2023, SIGMOBILE Research Highlights in 2016, 2018, and 2021, CACM Research Highlights in 2018, and was selected as a Best Paper Nominee at SenSys 2017. I have fully-funded Ph.D. student positions in the areas of mobile health, mobile systems, AI-related sensing technologies, and ubiquitous computing. Please send your CV and transcripts to me via litianx2@msu.edu if you are interested.
